text: In the present study, we examined the presence of glucocorticoid receptors (GRs) and cyclooxygenase-2 (COX-2) in the nasal polyps of nonallergic patients as compared with normal controls.

text: In contrast, in normal nasal tissues, COX-2 labeling was only found in the vascular wall, and the expression was weaker--a finding demonstrating that COX-2 is upregulated in nasal polyps.

text: Therefore, 1) the presence of GRs and COX-2 in nasal polyps from nonallergic patients, as well as upregulation of COX-2 expression, suggests that inflammation may play an important role in the pathophysiology of nasal polyps; and 2) glucocorticoid could be a potential treatment method for suppressing inflammatory processes.
